body: You can bookmark urls with the username and password embedded.
That leaves the password in unprotected storage though.

rename.to: Use a real login screen + sessions instead of HTTP basic auth

body: If this gets implemented, it would be rather nice if it were optional.  The current basic authentication makes it really easy to punt authentication upstream when proxying Syncthing, which is particularly useful in some cases.
You can use the API key to authenticate, if that also fits your use-case.
Mmm. But I think we would still have to accept basic auth credentials for compatibility reasons. Possibly, in the long run, limiting it to localhost-bound or https.
Please refrain from "me too" comments as they add no value. You can use tye emote icons on the original post if you can't contain yourself.

What's the status of this feature request at the moment?
It would be really good to provide form-based login as well as HTTP basic auth, similar to how apps like sonarr/radarr allow this.
It's the same status as it wad 2 years ago, which is "sure, but we're not bothered about it, if you are, open PRs"

issue.title: YARFFBA (Yet Another Request For a Forms Based Authentication) ;)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
[Looks](https://forum.syncthing.net/t/forms-based-gui-authentication/10775). [Like](https://forum.syncthing.net/t/http-login-screen/9752). I'm not the first to request this.

I use LastPass to store/fill everything, and having the old skool login popup makes it so I have to manually search for and copy my ST credentials every time I need to login to it. Any chance this could be added soon? Looks like the first time it was requested was around 2 years(!) ago. lol

(Before anyone says to do a PR, I've just got way too many projects on my plate right now.)

issue.title: Web GUI requests password in an uncomfortable way

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
I've set up the Syncthing web GUI to require username and password to open it. Syncthing Tray handles it quite well, but if I want to log in to the web GUI from by browser I'll quickly find myself troubled.

What I expect to happen?
1. I enter localhost:8384
2. A login page appears, so I can use the Bitwarden plugin in my browser to automatically fill in the credentials, or at least to be able to copy the username and password from the plugin's window and paste them manually.
3. I successfully enter the web GUI

What happens?
1. I enter localhost:8384
2. A new window opens requesting for credentials, which blocks the whole browser UI, so I can't open any plugin's window
3. I click cancel, and close the tab
4. Copy the credentials from the Bitwarden plugin to notepad
5. Re-enter localhost:8384
6. Paste the credentials from notepad
7. I successfully enter the web GUI

This is even more boring since Syncthing Tray wants to open the web GUI on every single reboot for some reason. But this should be an other issue in the appropriate project.

### Version Information

Syncthing Version: v1.3.0
OS Version: Windows 10 1903
Browser Version: Firefox 70.0.1

body:
As a workaround, we can use a web extension that has partially solved this problem.  Bitwarden claims it can log automatically given you have only account on your localhost domain: https://github.com/bitwarden/clients/issues/116#issuecomment-327991012

I couldn't get it to work exactly as advertised, but it still lets me copy and paste the password from the extension without blocking the UI.

Other extensions exist, but I haven't tested them (e.g., passman and passifox).
A regular login page would really help. Login with that popup is really a distraction....
